text: Gordon is a former community in Sherman County, Oregon, United States. It was first settled in 1875 by Tom Gordon, an Irish immigrant, and formally established with a post office in 1896, which only operated from July to December that year before closing. Gordon is contemporarily considered a ghost town. ==References== Category:1896 establishments in Oregon Category:Populated places established in 1896 Category:Former populated places in Sherman County, Oregon Category:Ghost towns in Oregon Category:Unincorporated communities in Sherman County, Oregon
title: Gordon, Oregon
